short_description: The challenge for this round is to make a track using JS80P and OB-Xf.
long_description: The JS80P by Attila M. Magyar, https://attilammagyar.github.io/js80p/, is a synth inspired by the Yamaha CS-80.  It is a free and open source VST plugin for Linux and Windows (no Mac) supporting subtractive, additive, FM, PM, and AM synthesis.  If you are a Mac user however you will not be let down as the wonderful OB-Xf, https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/OB-Xf, is also allowed.  Your challenge for this round is to **make a track using the JS80P and/or the OB-Xf**.  You can use as many instances of the JS80P or the OB-Xf as you like, with any effect, any sampler and any DAW as long as they are ğŸğ«ğğ ğšğ§ğ ğ¨ğ©ğğ§ ğ¬ğ¨ğ®ğ«ğœğ.  You are not allowed to record audio intrumental or vocal performances.  *Happy Music Making!*
